bug.short_desc: User is not able to select emojis from digit keys
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
When user tries to enter an Emoji character by keyboard shortcut(number), the selection does not work. For e.g. if user enters smile and tries to select an emoji at position 5 in the candidate window by pressing '5' key, the selection does not work. Instead the number 5 gets entered. User has to use arrow keys to select the same.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): ibus-1.5.14-2.fc25.x86_64 Fedora 25 workstation
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. install fedora 25 2. enable Emojis as per https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/IBus_Emoji_Typing 3. run gedit and enter keyword as 'smile' 4. from candidate selection window, try to select emoji at position 5 by pressing '5'
Actual results: The selection by keyboard using numbers does not work. The number 5 gets entered instead of the emoji at position 5.
Expected results: The selection should work.
Additional info:
I thought "100" is an emoji so the number could not be used to select the candidate. But 0th candidate does not exist in "1" emoji so probably I can think this issue again.

Furthermore testing, C-S-u + 1 + 1 shows emoji 11 hours. If this request is implemented, C-S-u + 1 + 1 commits emoji 1 hour.
Emoji 11 hour is also provided by C-S-u + "clock".
I'm not sure which is more important.
